Hello, 

I am currently stuck with the problem that I have sometimes no dat=
a
for my input neurons. My input range is from 0..1 and I have about
100 in=
put neurons. In my training data and later using real data, I
have only for=
 50% of those neurons input values. There is just no
value I can assign as =
there is no data available.

I can not create a new neural net for every po=
ssible combination of
missing input value as there are very much  possible =
combinations.

As I can not assign NAN to these input neurons, I was experi=
menting
with the following:

1) Assigning 0 if there is no data available. =
If there is data
available then I assigned:
x =3D (x/2)+0.5

So the new ran=
ge was 0.5 to 1.0 if there is data and 0 if there was
none. But this was no=
t working very well. I assume the NN "thought"
the 0 is just like 0.5 but l=
ower as it has no signal.

2) Also assigning 0 when there is no data, but a=
ssign also 0 if it is
a really 0. The NN can not know/decide if the 0 is be=
cause the data is
really 0 or because it is not available

This version run=
s slightly better. But not very good anyway.

What can I do to solve this p=
roblem? maybe assign -1 if there is no
data available? Or just create one a=
dditional input neuron for every
other input neuron and assign 0/1 regardin=
g data is available or not?

So for example if there is no data available I=
 assign the data node 0
and the no data available node to 1. Would that hel=
p? 

How are you solving such a problem?

Thank you very much in advance,

=
Christian
